card.title: Who is Eric Zemmour? France's Tucker Carlson Electrifies the Presidential Race.

_source.content:
"As it now stands, Zemmour, Le Pen, and the mainstream conservative candidate which has yet to be nominated, are all polling around 15 percent of the vote while Macron sits on a comfortable base of around 25 percent. card.description: The City of Los Angeles said there would be "no restrictions" on how the 3,000 families on the scheme can spend the $1,000 monthly payments.
card.title: Los Angeles is launching the US' biggest guaranteed income pilot. The scheme will pay $1,000 a month to 3,000 families.

_source.content:
Continued
Part 2

Ca. Basic income

Price told the City Council that the "positive results" from the Stockton program made it clear that one in Los Angeles was needed, too.

"It's my hope that following the conclusion of this pilot program, that it'll be replicated at the state and federal level," Price said.

Los Angeles Mayor Eric Garcetti had said in his annual "state of the city" address in April that the city was looking at launching a $24 million UBI program to support the city's poor residents.

Applications open on Friday and close on November 7.

The recipients of the funding will be chosen at random from the eligible candidates by the Center for Guaranteed Income Research at the University of Pennsylvania, and will be contacted by the city in January.

card.title: Teen Immigrant Charged with 3 Counts of Murder, Released from Jail to Attend School

_source.content:
Teen Immigrant Charged with 3 Counts of Murder, Released from Jail to Attend School
Modawi faces three counts of murder and one count of aggravated assault with serious bodily injury stemming from an Oct. 1 joyriding incident that ended in tragedy.
The teenager who had worked as a valet at a Houston restaurant, was spotted by police at about 10:30 p.m. on Oct. 1 while driving a customer‚Äôs white Infiniti G37 and doing various stunts in a parking lot. Modawi fled when the officer who spotted him hit the lights and siren.
He did not get far but struck and killed three valets who worked at another restaurant, Eric Orduna, 22; Nick Rodriguez, 23; and Fran Measho, 18. He then flipped the car before it crashed into a fence. Modawi and a passenger each suffered leg injuries.

What Science Tells Us About God

 In 2019, Templeton Prize winner Marco Gleiser made waves when he said that ‚Äúatheism is inconsistent with the scientific method.‚Äù  In his view, atheism is a ‚Äúcategorical statement of belief,‚Äù and doesn‚Äôt depend on evidence as much as assumptions.

This, of course, clashes with claims of the so-called ‚ÄúNew Atheism,‚Äù that science has officially debunked God as an explanation for the universe. 
Gleiser is an agnostic, and thinks scientists shouldn‚Äôt close off the possibility of God. 
 
This accomplished scientist is saying something very important:  atheism is not science‚Äôs default position. 
 
On the other hand, it‚Äôs important to note that science is not completely silent on the God question either, which is why generations of scientists have been drawn to a belief in the Creator precisely because of what they noticed in the universe they were observing. 
 
To put it another way, atheism isn‚Äôt inconsistent with the scientific method just because it‚Äôs a ‚Äúcategorial belief,‚Äù but because it denies the order, complexity, and intentionality that point to God-centered conclusions.

   

After Humanity: Understanding Lewis's The Abolition of Man

 The Abolition of Man is likely C.S. Lewis's most challenging work. It is dense and rich with analysis and direction. Thankfully, Dr. Michael Ward has written a companion to guide readers through Lewis's piece thought-by-thought.
Shane interviews Dr. Ward today, exploring Ward's After Humanity and explaining a few of the finer points of The Abolition of Man.
 
Listen to the Interview>>

Does the Church Value Women?

 Are men and women valued as equal partners in the work, ministry, and function of the Church? Elyse Fitzpatrick and Eric Schumacher co-authored the book Worthy: Celebrating the Value of Women and joined us to talk about why it is not good for "man to be alone."
 
Listen to the Interview>>

card.title: Green Bay Alderman Suggests Police Recruit Vaccine Mandate Opponents

_source.content:
Green Bay Alderman Suggests Police Recruit Vaccine Mandate Opponents
By Robert Kennedy
Oct 27, 2021

GREEN BAY, WI (WTAQ-WLUK) ‚Äì A Green Bay city council member is suggesting the city recruit police officers who left their previous job due to a COVID-19 vaccine mandate.

With ten police officer positions vacant out of 187, alderperson Chris Wery tells FOX 11 he wants to get ahead of the issue before more officers leave or retire.

‚ÄúIt seems like every day you wake up and there‚Äôs shots fired somewhere.‚Äù

Just as Governor Ron DeSantis has pitched in Florida, Wery suggests offering $5,000 bonuses for police officers willing to relocate to Green Bay.

Wery specifically says there should be good candidates to choose from in cities where vaccines were recently mandated for officers.

‚ÄúWe keep complaining we can‚Äôt get people to apply, why not take advantage of that?‚Äù

FOX 11 asked Wery where he believes the money should come from.

‚ÄúActually the federal money that we‚Äôre getting the 20 some million dollars, a portion of it you can use for safety, so that would be a logical place to take it from.‚Äù

FOX 11 asked Green Bay Mayor Eric Genrich about Wery‚Äôs idea.

‚ÄúDefinitely interested in exploring the option of covering relocation costs for officers who are interested in working for the Green Bay Police Department, but not necessarily supportive of getting involved in the politicization of one‚Äôs vaccine status,‚Äù said Genrich.

Genrich says he‚Äôd like to ramp up marketing efforts to recruit candidates. Police Chief Chis Davis agrees.

‚ÄúPeople find our agency if they‚Äôre looking for another place to work. We get a little better return on investment sometimes from good marketing of open positions. We support our police department and I‚Äôve demonstrated that over the course of the last few budgets, so we believe we‚Äôre a really attractive place.‚Äù

Genrich proposed adding five police officer positions back to the Green Bay Police Department in his 2020 budget proposal, which the city council included in its final plan.

FOX 11 asked Genrich if he has considered a vaccinate mandate for the police department.

‚ÄúCertainly we‚Äôve been following what has been going on in different municipalities across the state. Our human resources director and our law department have been engaged in conversations with municipalities across Wisconsin to see what others are doing, but it‚Äôs not something we‚Äôre actually contemplating.‚Äù

Chief Davis did not know how many of his officers are vaccinated against COVID-19.

It has been reported larger police departments across the country have lost hundreds of officers due to vaccine mandates.

As of last week, about one third (more than 4,500 employees) of Chicago‚Äôs police department still had not submitted their vaccination status. https://wtaq.com/2021/10/27/green-bay-alderman-suggests-police-recruit-vaccine-mandate-opponents/
